DOC.brief_summary: Multi-center , dual cohort ( randomize single vessel ) study design demonstrate feasibility , initial safety performance Kips Bay Medical , Inc. eSVS® Mesh external vein support device use saphenous vein graft coronary artery bypass surgery . In Randomized Cohort , study subject receive SVG without Mesh ( control ) SVG eSVS Mesh ( treatment ) . In Single Vessel Cohort , study subject receive one SVG eSVS Mesh .
DOC.criteria: Randomized Cohort : Requires CABG surgery SVG right coronary artery ( RCA ) system AND leave circumflex artery ( LCX ) system ≥ 70 % stenosis two system . Single Vessel Cohort : Requires CABG surgery SVG RCA system LCX system > 70 % stenosis system . Medial sternotomy cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) surgery . Both saphenous vein graft length adequate plan intervention , vein out diameter 3.6 mm 7.0 mm double wall thickness le 1.4 mm . Agreement postprocedure followup contact test ( include followup coronary angiogram ) . Concomitant nonCABG cardiac procedure . Prior cardiac surgery ( include percutaneous procedure ) . Cerebrovascular transient ischemia attack within 30 day CABG procedure . Age > 85 year . Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 35 % . Creatinine > 133 μmol/L ( 1.5 mg/dL ) prior CABG procedure chronic dialysis . STEMI within 7 day total CK > 2 time upper limit normal prior CABG procedure . Both enrolled graft fee nonviable myocardial territory . Diffuse atherosclerotic disease ( > 70 % ) distal either enrol target coronary artery . Randomized Cohort : By visual estimate , target coronary artery diameter right coronary system leave circumflex system must within 1.5mm . Planned endarterectomy target coronary artery .
